summary: Wellington is the capital and third-largest city of New Zealand, located on the North Island. It's known for its windy weather and is the world's southernmost capital of a sovereign state. The city was designed in 1840 and has been New Zealand's capital since 1865. Wellington has a strong service-based economy, focusing on finance, government, and the film industry. It's also a major seaport and has a vibrant, youth-driven culture, often ranked as one of the world's most liveable cities. The population is around 215,200 in the urban area and 440,900 in the wider metropolitan region.
title: Wellington
